message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI 

The paper discusses a practical approach for controlling Sybil attacks in distributed systems, which falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The paper also addresses security concerns and proposes a decentralized scheme, which falls under the category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). The proposed scheme involves solving computational puzzles, which falls under the category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also evaluates the proposed scheme through simulations, which falls under the category of Systems and Control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the practical issues involved in deploying the proposed scheme, which falls under the category of Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI).
